intro: Sedum versadense, commonly known as the variable sedum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Crassulaceae. It is native to parts of Europe and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, depending on the variety. Sedum versadense is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It is a hardy perennial that is relatively easy to grow in gardens and rockeries.
